snippet: One book gives the history of the 15th New York National Guard Regiment; another traces the trajectory of high finance in New York City; and another is on Huguette Clark, a reclusive copper heiress who died in 2011.
abstract: Sam Roberts reviews books Harlem’s Rattlers and the Great War: The Undaunted 369th Regiment and the African American Quest for Equality by Jeffrey T Sammons and John H Morrow Jr, Capital of Capital: Money, Banking + Power in New York City, 1784-2012 by Steven H Jaffe and Jessica Lautin and The Phantom of Fifth Avenue: The Mysterious Life and Scandalous Death of Heiress Huguette Clark by Meryl Gordon.
lead_paragraph: One book gives the history of the 15th New York National Guard Regiment; another traces the trajectory of high finance in New York City; and another is on Huguette Clark, a reclusive copper heiress who died in 2011.

headline.print_headline: Hellfighters, High Finance and an Heiress
